column4: well with my experiences the current user can use it, just make sure you use sudo before executing it again. Now since it is a hardware driver, it  might require you to run as root using 'su root'  etc.
just make sure you log out of r00t when you are done :D
ubuntu doesn't use su root.. ubuntu uses sudo
not these driver files.. but headers and build-essential might be necessary to compile the kernel mod
